conclusion: Car A drives in from the right and interacts with blocks based on power, collision, and deflection effects.
The image shows a loose cluster of blocks of various colors (red, orange, blue, green, yellow, purple) on a green surface, with car A positioned on the right side moving leftward.
Car A moves leftward with enough speed to reach the loose ring of blocks, and the nearest block is the lone red one on the lower-right edge of the cluster.
Car A hits the red block head-on, pushing it forward a short distance while losing only a small part of its speed.
The impact nudges car A slightly upward toward the picture’s top because the block’s center is below A’s centerline.
The upward-deflected trajectory intersects the orange block sitting just above and left of the blue block.
Car A hits the orange block in a glancing collision, knocking it up-and-left while further reducing A’s forward speed and turning its heading slightly upward again.
After the orange collision, car A’s altered path lines up with the bright-blue block.
Car A makes contact with the blue block in another glancing collision, sliding the blue block leftward and slowing A to the point where its wheels no longer overcome rolling resistance.

With most of its kinetic energy spent after three collisions, car A rolls a short extra distance past the blue block and comes to rest inside the boundary of the block cluster near the gap between the blue and purple blocks.
Car A collides with the red block first, the orange block second, and the blue block third, eventually stopping slightly left of the blue block inside the loose circle of cubes.
